segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the beginning of a message and to transmit identifying number.
DTM, A segment to indicate a date and time applying to the whole message, such as: - ultimate execution date/time
FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable supplementary information, such as: - change information

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments containing a reference and constants which apply to the entire message.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to express a reference which applies to the entire message, such as: - reference to previous message - work order reference number
DTM, A segment to indicate a date and time relating to the reference, such as: - order date/time (work order)

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to identify a party and related contacts.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the party's name, address, and function, such as: - message recipient - message sender - ordering customer (if different from message sender)
CTA, A segment to identify a person or department for the party, such as: - information contact

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to specify containers in which goods are transported.

segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to specify container prefix and number.
RFF, A segment to provide a reference specific to the equipment, such as: - inspection number
DTM, A segment to provide a date and time relating to the equipment, such as: - inspection date/time - release date/time
LOC, A segment to provide a location relating to the equipment, such as: - place of inspection
FTX, A segment to specify processable supplementary information associated with the container, such as: - description work item equipment (on terminal, depot or freight station)
GOR, A segment to specify a governmental requirement relating to the equipment, such as: - government procedure to be conducted
HAN, A segment to specify a handling instruction relating to the equipment, such as: - put aside for cleaning - put aside for Customs examination

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to specify related transport details for the equipment.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to specify main carriage transport details.
LOC, A segment to specify a location associated with the transport details, such as: - place of departure - place of arrival
DTM, A segment to specify a date/time relating to the transport details, such as arrival or departure date/time.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to identify different parties/places related to the equipment.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to specify a related addres or party.
CTA, A segment to identify a person or department for the specified party.
CNT, A segment to specify the number of containers in the message, explicitly given by the sender.
